properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 23 at 8:41AM PST until January 24 at 12:36PM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
NW Oregon/SW Washington Coastal Basins Bulletin

...The National Weather Service in Portland has issued a flood
warning for the following rivers in Washington...

Grays River near Rosburg affecting Wahkiakum County

.Heavy rain will continue through at least early afternoon in the
Willapa Hills, causing the Grays to continue rising through about
5 pm today.

River forecasts are based on observed and forecast rainfall and
temperatures. For the latest river stages and forecasts, visit
weather.gov/portland.

The next update for this location will be issued by 430 pm PST.

The National Weather Service in Portland has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Grays River near Rosburg
* until Friday afternoon.
* At 8 AM Thursday the stage was...12.8 feet / 9900 cfs.
* Flood stage is 12.0 feet and flood flow is 8200 cfs.
* Minor flooding is occurring.
* Forecast...This river has risen sharply since 4 am and is forecast
continue rising and to crest near 15.0 ft Thursday afternoon.
After the crest, it is forecast to fall below flood stage Friday
morning.
* Impact...Above 14 feet, expect widespread lowland flooding and
numerous flooded roads near Rosburg and Hwy 4. This includes the
roadway approaches to the Altoona Bridge over the Grays River.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown. Don't drive into flooded areas.
Avoid walking near riverbanks during high water.
